meanings.definition: To rise or float in the air, especially as a result of supernatural or magical forces.
meanings.sent1: The magician levitated above the stage during the performance.
meanings.sent2: The balloon levitated gently in the sky, carried by the wind.
meanings.sent3: The cat levitated playfully after chasing a butterfly.
meanings.sent4: Her spirits levitated with joy as she received the good news.
meanings.sent5: The superhero levitated effortlessly, soaring through the clouds.

meanings.definition: To cause to rise or float in the air, especially through supernatural or magical means.
meanings.sent1: The wizard levitated the book off the shelf with a wave of his wand.
meanings.sent2: The spell levitated the objects in the room, surprising everyone present.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous fairy levitated the cookies out of reach of the children.
meanings.sent4: His words levitated her spirits, lifting her out of despair.
meanings.sent5: The sorcerer levitated the stones effortlessly, showcasing his power.
